title: How to Make Honey Oat Bars

steps.headline: Combine the oats, sultanas, sugar, coconut and flour in a large mixing bowl.
Melt the butter or margarine in a microwave dish.
Mix the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Stir until the mixture clings together.

steps.headline: Press evenly over the base of a greased or sprayed/parchment-covered baking tray (sheet).
steps.description: As shown in the image, even the base of a loaf pan can be put to use for making bars; if you don't have a baking tray/sheet, use such a pan instead.

steps.headline: Bake in a moderate oven  350 °F (175 °C) for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
Cut the bars while hot.
steps.description: Cut into evenly sized bar shapes across the entire base. Remove the bars from the tray (sheet) when cool.

steps.headline: Finished.
steps.description: They can be eaten now or stored in an airtight container for later.

text: Preparing the Mixture Combine the oats, sultanas, sugar, coconut and flour in a large mixing bowl.  Melt the butter or margarine in a microwave dish. Add the honey and stir. Mix the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Stir until the mixture clings together. Baking the Mixture Press evenly over the base of a greased or sprayed/parchment-covered baking tray (sheet). As shown in the image, even the base of a loaf pan can be put to use for making bars; if you don't have a baking tray/sheet, use such a pan instead. Bake in a moderate oven  350 °F (175 °C) for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.  Making the Bar Shapes Cut the bars while hot. Cut into evenly sized bar shapes across the entire base. Remove the bars from the tray (sheet) when cool. Finished. They can be eaten now or stored in an airtight container for later.
